We performed disease simulations on modular networks with m = 5 modules and n = 40 nodes per module over a range of values of p and σ, and on spatial networks with N = 200 nodes over a range of values of r and σ. We measured the performance of the sentinel placement strategies, arbitrarily choosing s = 5. Fig 2 shows the difference in the number of cases after detection, Φ
A , between the global strategy and the modular or spatial strategy for their respective type of network over a range of values of degree heterogeneity, module assortativity (in the modular network), and connection radius (in the spatial network).
